page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: We visited six farms which cover most of the land marked, one of these, Hook End Farm, is known to have been mentioned in the{Domesday Book.}The sizes of the farms varied from 30 to 360 acres. Five of them had farm houses dating back to the 16th or 17th century. Most had removed{ancient {hedges}to enlarge their fields. Hook End alone is non-arable; they produce cattle for meat. Soaphouse Farm, the largest, did have a large herd of Fresians, but because of{EEC policy}it changed to arable in 1985. They keep a few cattle for breeding but are not allowed to sell milk as they have no licence.
